data.title: Northumbria University on LinkedIn: #takeontomorrow
data.meta_description: Our experts Dr Sonia Dalkin and Professor Katie Haighton are supporting a new ¬£1 million research study aimed at improving the hospital discharge process for‚Ä¶
data.text:
üåç üåç Proud to announce Northumbria University is now ranked as one of the top 50 universities IN THE WORLD for sustainability in Times Higher Education‚Äôs Impact Rankings 2024, which are published today üåç üåç The Impact Rankings assess how well almost 1,700 universities across the world work towards the UN‚Äôs Sustainable Development Goals. As well as ranking within the top 50 in the world overall, Northumbria is ranked top 10 in the world for stewardship ‚Äì showing that we are leading by example and running as sustainably as possible, especially in areas such as energy efficient renovation and building, water re-use policies, providing sustainable food choices and tracking food waste on campus. ‚ÄúUniversities can have significant impact on sustainability through their operational activities, but it is the influence they bring to bear more widely ‚Äì on students, cities and regions through their role as anchor institutions, and the national and international research communities ‚Äì that has the biggest impact on driving sustainability,‚Äù says Professor Andy Long, Vice-Chancellor and Chief Executive. ‚ÄúLeading by example is essential if we are to have credibility within these communities.‚Äù https://lnkd.in/eEmC93_m #TakeOnTomorrow #climatechange #THEImpact24 #THEglobalimpact

There's still time to register to be part of the prestigious annual International Volunteer Cooperation Organisations (IVCO) conference, which is being hosted for the first time in Newcastle upon Tyne, and will get under way on Monday 9 September. We're proud that our Northumbria Centre for Global Development researchers are working with Comhl√°mh, Irish Association of Development Workers and Volunteers, to host an impressive programme of speakers from across the world. #IVCO2024 #NUGlobalVolunteering ‚¨á Anyone with an interest in #volunteering and #development can find out more below.

Thinking about sticking around for your Masters? Students starting the final term of their undergraduate degree will no doubt be looking to the future. As a valued student at Northumbria, we want you to reach your full potential and continue your studies at Northumbria. That is why we offer a generous 20% tuition fee reduction off the cost of a Masters with the Alumni Discount, which can potentially save you up to ¬£2,350*. What are you waiting for? #TakeOnTomorrow and apply for a Masters today! Find out more https://orlo.uk/Fif0c . . . *Based on Category C tuition fee (¬£11,750). #AlumniDiscount #TakeOnTomorrow #Masters #MastersQualification #Postgraduate #PostgraduateDegree #NorthumbriaUniversity #IAmNorthumbria #Newcastle #PostgraduateStudy #StudentLife #UniLife

Northumbria University will host the Royal College of Nursing - Company‚Äôs International Nursing Research Conference for 2024 at its Newcastle City Campus over three days between Tuesday 10 and Thursday 12 September. The conference will bring together hundreds of individuals with an interest in nursing, health and social care research and aims to improve nursing practice through learning, networking, discussion and debate around the challenges facing the future nursing workforce. Titled ‚ÄòInclusivity in Nursing Research: Working Together to Make a Difference‚Äô, the event is worth 27 CPD points and is specifically aimed at showcasing research that addresses the needs of under-served populations and celebrating research that uses innovative designs to facilitate the inclusion of all stakeholders. Read more: https://orlo.uk/JnSqo #RCNresearch24 Annette Hand Carl May Roxanne CROSBY-NWAOBI Prof Rhonda Wilson Linda Tinkler Barbara Farquharson Jane Ball

Join us for our Understanding Generative AI for Your Organisation three-day training and consultancy programme in partnership with Okana. In the ever-evolving landscape, embracing technological advancements is key to staying ahead. Generative AI, especially with tools like ChatGPT Plus, offers groundbreaking opportunities for innovation and efficiency in the construction industry. Explore the transformative power of Generative AI in the construction industry.
